metadata.name: Remote Thread Created In Shell Application
metadata.comment: Detects remote thread creation in command shell applications, such as "Cmd.EXE" and "PowerShell.EXE". It is a common technique used by malware, such as IcedID, to inject malicious code and execute it within legitimate processes.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('4') AND (endswith(lower(process.file.path), lower('\\cmd.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.file.path), lower('\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.file.path), lower('\\pwsh.exe'))))

output.summary: Detects remote thread creation in command shell applications, such as "Cmd.EXE" and "PowerShell.EXE". It is a common technique used by malware, such as IcedID, to inject malicious code and execute it within legitimate processes.
